sources.data_found: C2B2 HPC cluster: 80 NVIDIA L40S GPUs with 48GB memory on GPU chips; 128 AMD EPYC 9654 processors (96-cores each); 64 compute nodes with 49 TB total memory.

Ginsburg cluster: 8 A100 GPU Nodes (2 GPU modules per server), 9 A40 GPU Nodes (2 GPU modules per server); total 286 nodes. Insomnia cluster went live in February 2024 as joint purchase by 21 research groups.
Department of Systems Biology cluster: 6,336 CPU-cores and 73,728 CUDA-cores (GPU) with maximum performance of 212 TFlops.
High Performance Computing Cluster at CUIMC upgraded in 2024, supported by NIH grant S10OD032433.

In 2023, Computer Science awarded 595 Master's degrees and General Computer & Information Sciences awarded 709 Master's degrees. Total enrollment: 35,279 students (9,111 undergraduate, 26,168 graduate).
Engineering School enrollment statistics by ethnicity (Fall 2024). Undergraduate Engineering includes 4 visiting, 6 study abroad, 1 non-degree student.

student_data.notes: CS undergraduate estimate based on typical distribution within Engineering school (~9,111 total undergrads). Graduate CS count (690) from Peterson's guide. PhD estimate based on typical doctoral program size for top CS departments. DataUSA shows 595 CS MS + 709 General CS MS degrees awarded in 2023, indicating substantial CS graduate enrollment.

other_high_vram_gpus.model: Mixed legacy GPUs in 73,728 CUDA cores
other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Department of Systems Biology cluster has 73,728 CUDA-cores total. Based on 2013 installation date and assuming V100/older GPUs (80 CUDA cores per V100), estimated ~917 V100-equivalent GPUs.

gpu_resources.notes:
GPU RESOURCES CALCULATION:

1) C2B2 (CUIMC) cluster: 80 L40S GPUs (48GB each)

2) Ginsburg (CUIT) cluster: 
   - A100: 8 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 16 A100 GPUs
   - A40: 9 nodes × 2 GPUs/node = 18 A40 GPUs

3) Systems Biology legacy cluster: 73,728 CUDA cores from 2013 installation. Assuming V100-era GPUs with ~80 CUDA cores each = ~917 V100-equivalent GPUs

4) Insomnia cluster (2024): Configuration not specified in sources, likely additional GPUs not counted

TOTAL COUNTED: 80 L40S + 16 A100 + 18 A40 + 917 V100-equivalent = 1,031 GPUs

analysis_notes: Columbia has multiple HPC clusters across different schools/departments. Main resources include C2B2 cluster at medical center (80 L40S), Ginsburg cluster (16 A100 + 18 A40), legacy Systems Biology cluster (~917 V100-equivalent), and new Insomnia cluster (specs not found). Student counts estimated from available data: 690 graduate CS students confirmed, undergrad/PhD estimated based on typical distributions.
